_header: The hart loveth the wood the hare loveth the hill
Note:
Cf. a variant in Opie and Opie (1951)
XIona Archibald Opie, and Peter Opie. The Oxford Dictionary of Nursery Rhymes. Oxford: Clarendon, 1951, 200; cf. also 5217, 5224.
_description: Satirical proverbs on women — 8 short lines, abcbdbeb (or four long lines, aaaa)

YaleBei365.First Lines:
The hart lovyt þe woodThe here lovyt þe
                    hyll…
YaleBei365.Last Lines:
…The properte of a schroe [ ]eenys to haue hyr
                    wyll
YaleBei365.Note:
Written two lines of verse to one line of MS; word in penultimate line
                    partly written over.
YaleBei365.Editions:
Smith,  Lucy Toulmin,
                        ed.  
             A Commonplace Book of the Fifteenth Century.
         Norwich: Kerrison, Goose, 1886: 11.
